title: TERMS AND CONDITIONS
description: Sets the foundational rules that govern the relationship between the user and the service provider, including acceptance of the agreement and its scope.

title: A ITUNES STORE, MAC APP STORE, APP STORE, AND IBOOKS STORE TERMS OF SALE
description: Details the terms related to purchasing, including payments, taxes, refund policies, rights of cancellation, and more for transactions through iTunes and other stores.

title: GIFT CERTIFICATES, ITUNES CARDS AND CODES, ALLOWANCES, AND CONTENT CODES
description: Elaborates on the rules concerning the redemption and limitations of gift certificates, iTunes cards, codes, and allowances within the associated stores.

title: GIFTS
description: Outlines the guidelines around purchasing and redemption of gifts within the store, emphasizing geographical limitations and technical requirements.

title: IMPORTANT SAFETY INFORMATION
description: Provides safety precautions and guidelines to prevent physical discomfort or health issues during the use of product offerings from the stores.

title: PRE-ORDERS
description: Describes the terms and flexibility regarding placing pre-orders on the store, and outlines the conditions of cancellation.

title: FAMILY SHARING
description: Explains the Family Sharing feature which allows shared access to store products among family members, including roles, permissions, and responsibilities.

title: ELECTRONIC CONTRACTING
description: Affirms that user interactions and agreements within the stores are legally binding even when completed electronically.

title: B ITUNES STORE TERMS AND CONDITIONS
description: Specifies the legal agreement governing usage of the iTunes Store service, including rights, responsibilities, and conditions for its use.

title: THE ITUNES STORE SERVICE
description: Describes the service offered by iTunes, including accessibility, purchase options, and licensing details.

title: REQUIREMENTS FOR USE OF THE SERVICE
description: Specifies age restrictions, geographical availability, technical requirements, and device compatibility needed to use the service.

title: YOUR ACCOUNT
description: Explains the responsibility of maintaining account security, importance of keeping information accurate, and how account data is used.

title: AUTOMATIC DELIVERY AND DOWNLOADING PREVIOUS PURCHASES
description: Offers details for downloading purchased content on multiple devices, along with stipulations on device associations.

title: ITUNES MATCH
description: Describes the iTunes Match service, including subscription details, capability to access music across devices, and associated liabilities.

title: PRIVACY
description: Details Apple's privacy practices surrounding user data collected via features like Genius and explains how this data is leveraged for user benefits.

title: CONTENT AVAILABILITY
description: iTunes reserves the right to alter available content without prior notice.

title: USE OF CONTENT
description: Outlines the licensing conditions for iTunes products and includes restrictions on content use.

title: USAGE RULES
description: Defines specific rules governing the use of iTunes products, including personal use limitations and device restrictions.

title: CONTENT SECURITY
description: Addresses the security measures that accompany the digital content and prohibitions against attempting to bypass them.

title: SERVICE SECURITY
description: Details security measures and restrictions in accessing the service, focusing on preventing unauthorized access.

title: SEASON PASS, MULTI-PASS
description: Outlines terms related to purchasing Season Pass and Multi-Pass, including duration, renewal, and refund policies.

title: HIGH-DEFINITION (HD) PRODUCTS
description: Describes the viewing and usage conditions for HD products offered through the store.

title: SUBMISSIONS TO THE SERVICE
description: Covers user submissions to the service, describing rights, responsibilities, and permissions granted to iTunes for use of submitted content.

title: THIRD-PARTY MATERIALS
description: Discusses materials or services from third parties accessed via the service, releasing iTunes from liability regarding their accuracy or use.

title: OBJECTIONABLE MATERIAL
description: Addresses the potential for encountering offensive material via the service and assumes no liability for such encounters.

title: INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY
description: Clarifies the ownership of intellectual property associated with iTunes and its service, emphasizing limitations on user rights to modify or use protected materials.

title: TERMINATION
description: Describes the conditions under which iTunes can terminate the agreement or user accounts, including events of breach.

title: MISCELLANEOUS
description: Outlines the general provisions and stipulations not covered in other sections, and notes how the agreement supersedes prior ones.

title: Limitation of Liability
description: Discusses the limitations placed on the liability of the Licensor, detailing conditions where the Licensor and its affiliates are not liable for damages, including specific breaches that may occur.

title: You may not use or otherwise export or re-export
description: Outlines the restrictions on the export and re-export of the Licensed Application, emphasizing compliance with United States laws, and detailing explicit prohibitions on transferring the application to specific countries or persons.

title: The Licensed Application and related documentation
description: Defines the Licensed Application as a Commercial Item under U.S. regulatory codes, specifying the rights granted to U.S. Government end-users and emphasizing the reservation of all unpublished rights under United States copyright laws.

title: FURTHER IBOOKS STORE TERMS AND CONDITIONS
description: Provides additional terms related to the use of iBooks Store Products, clarifying the licensing agreement between users and publishers rather than with the store itself.

title: LICENSE OF IBOOKS STORE PRODUCTS
description: Clarifies that iBooks Store Products are sold under a license arrangement, specifying that the license is between the user and the third-party publisher, while iTunes facilitates the sale without being a party to the license terms.

title: IBOOKS STORE PRODUCT USAGE RULES
description: Lists the conditions under which iBooks Store Products can be used, including the number of devices allowed and restrictions on burning or promotional use.
